intro: Bergeranthus montis-moltkei, commonly known as the Moltke's bergeranthus, is a rare and striking plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, humid climates. Its flowers are usually a mix of red, orange, and yellow, creating a dramatic visual display. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a delicate and endangered species.
